title: Congratulating the Elmont Union Free School District for the success of its Model UN Program
fulltext:
LEGISLATIVE  RESOLUTION  congratulating  the  Elmont  Union  Free School
District for the success of its Model UN Program

WHEREAS, It is the sense of  this  Legislative  Body  to  recognize  and
commend  those  institutions  of  commitment  and high achievement whose
purpose and endeavors prove a dedication to the pursuit of excellence in
the education of the youth of this noble Empire State; and
  WHEREAS, Attendant to such concern, and in full accord with its  long-
standing  traditions, this Legislative Body is justly proud to congratu-
late the Elmont Union Free School District for the success of its  Model
UN Program; and
  WHEREAS,  Al  Harper,  Superintendent  of the Elmont Elementary School
District, and Lee Markus, founder of the  Elmont  Model  United  Nations
Program,  established  the  elementary Model United Nations Program; Mr.
Markus, in collaboration with Elmont teachers, has directed  and  guided
the students in their study and discussion of global issues; and
  WHEREAS,  The  Model United Nations Program is an interactive learning
experience that simulates the  process  and  procedures  of  the  United
Nations  General  Assembly; students simulate U.N. ambassadors to debate
current issues on the  organization's  agenda;  student  delegates  make
speeches,  prepare  draft  resolutions, negotiate with allies and adver-
saries, resolve conflicts, and navigate the Model United Nations confer-
ence rules of procedure, all in the  interest  of  mobilizing  "interna-
tional  cooperation"  to resolve problems that affect countries all over
the world; and
  WHEREAS, The six elementary  schools  within  the  Elmont  Union  Free
School  District  which  implement  this  particular  program are: Dutch
Broadway, Alden Terrace, Clara Carlson, Gotham  Avenue,  Stewart  Manor,
and Covert Avenue; and
  WHEREAS, The Elmont Union Free School District is proudly aware of its
distinguished  past, eager to fulfill its present commitment to parents,
students and the community, and planning with vision and purpose for the
ebb and swell of growth and change it will encounter  in  the  years  to
come; now, therefore, be it
  RESOLVED,  That  this  Legislative  Body pause in its deliberations to
congratulate the Elmont Union Free School District for  the  success  of
its Model UN Program; and be it further
  RESOLVED, That copies of this Resolution, suitably engrossed, be tran-
smitted  to  Al  Harper,  Superintendent of the Elmont Elementary School
District, and Lee Markus, Founder, Model UN Program.
